heading: rants & raves
subheading: sent: thursday, august 31, 2000 4:06 pm from: michael w. dwyer (dwyer@entelics.com) to: newsfeedback@wired.com subject: burning man’s for geeks, too! you missed the biggest story, which is that burning man is a completely bogus non-event staged by burned-out, bored technologists who regret that they missed out on all the good stuff (i.e., drugs and sex) […]
author: wired blogs
text: sent: thursday, august 31, 2000 4:06 pm from: michael w. dwyer (dwyer@entelics.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: burning man's for geeks, too!you missed the biggest story, which is that burning man is a completely bogus non-event staged by burned-out, bored technologists who regret that they missed out on all the good stuff (i.e., drugs and sex) earlier in life ("burning man's for geeks, too!," aug. 31, 2000). an exercise in delayed adolescence by people who find being adults less than fulfilling.ask yourself: what that's worthwhile has ever come out of this pretentious exercise in fatuousness? sorry to sound a negative note, but it occurred to me that somebody should clue you in to the fact that absolutely no one outside the forlorn participants gives a whiz about this shindig except naive journalists who are trying to figure out where the cultural action is.
